content.description: After climbing animal craggers wall this is a must. Starts on a hollow flake then rounds its way up on some classic gower crimps. Crux is about 15ft up trying to get over a hump. This wall is easily visible from its brown coloring towards the top.
content.location: After climbing animal craggers walk to the base of the wall to the right about 30ft away. Currently its not setup for sport so a TR must be setup. Careful with the approach; it’s hairy.

content.description: A northwest facing boulder standing far above all others in the area holds a beautiful crack with a bolt at the top to pair with a cam for an anchor.
content.protection: Smaller cams, may take nuts too
content.location: Go to base of the main wall and it is on the right. Can't miss it, or can you due to its large amount of moss on it's camoflauge face.

content.description: At the base of the first wall you see just to the northwest of moss crack. You can easily walk to the top for a TR. It is a fun slab with small crimps and friction moves, Crux is about 15ft from the start and its gets easier as you ascend. Bolted for sport.
content.protection: 7 bolts to the top. Two TR bolts on top
content.location: First main wall in the west Gower area. Use the approach trail along the side off moss crack rock and continue up to the left to get to the base.
